text: this is Sarah while reporting from
London before news corporation announced
this shocking decision to withdraw its
bid for BSkyB things were looking pretty
rough for the prime minister in a series
of bruising exchanges today in
Parliament he was criticized for his
ties Murdock Empire for his decision to
hire Andy Coulson the decision to employ
a tabloid editor meant that there were a
number of people who said this was not a
good idea particularly when that tabloid
editor had been at the news of the world
went bad things that happen the decision
to drop the bskyb bid I think gives him
a little bit of breathing room now
because there's not the issue hanging
over his government's head of whether or
not this vid will go forward the Prime
Minister today has announced the terms
of the inquiry that he said he would
convene it will be judge led it will
take its powers from the inquiries Act
it will be able to cool people under
oath and I think this is absolutely
vital as I say there are three pillars
to this there is the issue of police

and future one suggestion now is that
there should be much greater
transparency between reporters and
politicians when they have meetings or

not in the open the latest opinion poll

he's an incredibly strategic thinker if

and when you think about News
Corporation writ large this was

Parliament all the leaders were standing

for now so yes this deal was always said

I'm curious how james Murdoch the man
will ultimately fair he's also someone
who obviously was in the midst of this

about the relationship inside the

done that news of the world was the
first paper he bought outside Australia
newspapers are his first love he still
spends eighty percent of his time
dealing with newspapers to the point
that he rewrites headlines James is a

BSkyB he very much wanted this deal in
the long run they this may still be the
best way to complete the deal so you

from now they can still come back at
this yeah I think they can come back
don't forget you know when Murdoch

15 years he's always been a guy with
very very long horizons and even though
he's 80 years old that hasn't changed
